title: If you could only play one game for the rest of your life, what would it be?

author.bio: Sick of the bots here. There has to be a middle ground between can't discuss anything on a site because you'll be banned for wrongthink, and can't discuss anything on a site because every thread is a repost by bots, commented on by bots, upvoted by bots...

author.bio: Sick of the bots here. There has to be a middle ground between can't discuss anything on a site because you'll be banned for wrongthink, and can't discuss anything on a site because every thread is a repost by bots, commented on by bots, upvoted by bots...

body: Neither? I guess D&D is closer to a board game than a computer one, but it's books and pencils at best, and more oral storytelling/communication than anything else.
body_html: Neither? I guess D&D is closer to a board game than a computer one, but it's books and pencils at best, and more oral storytelling/communication than anything else.

post.title: If you could only play one game for the rest of your life, what would it be?

body: Arma 3, I think. The amount of mods the community has made has made the potential almost unlimited. It's my second most played game on Steam besides Mount and Blade: Warband, but I can play it for longer before I get bored.
body_html: Arma 3, I think. The amount of mods the community has made has made the potential almost unlimited. It's my second most played game on Steam besides Mount and Blade: Warband, but I can play it for longer before I get bored.
